author: headelf
title: Grow Senior market to Grow Cardano!
description: The Senior population controls wealth worldwide but doesn’t understand DeFi - what is Cardano doing to attract this market and liquidity?

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge setting aims to increase the onboarding of new people in the Cardano ecosystem, more precisely the participation of seniors on Cardano. 

In order for Cardano to achieve its goals we will need a community of users participating in the ecosystem much larger than what exists today, so I see this challenge in line with Cardano's mission. 

The subject of this challenge is not directly linked to the Catalyst Fund9 Challenge Setting Strategic Goals set out in the Community Advisor Assessment Guide. Before attracting users in a massive way, we need to have a reasonable core structure and today Cardano is in a phase of constant technical updates regarding the Alonzo, Goguen and Voltaire phases. 

That said, I see challenges that seek to make blockchain foundations (development ecosystem and dapps) a priority over challenge that seek to grow adoption at this point and I don't see Cardano adoption by seniors as critical for Fund9.
f6_assessments.q1:
Many of the potential directions of this challenge are solutions that are continuously being developed in the crypto space and are mostly of low technical complexity. E.g: Improvements in the user experience are an important aspect and always sought after by the various projects under development in blockchain. Through DApps and more user-friendly sites, the barrier to access for seniors tends to decrease. So, in relation to the technical capacity and people able to develop proposals in this challenge, I believe that the challenge is viable. The only point that leaves me in doubt is about setting a relatively high initial budget, $500,000 USD, for a topic with a relatively narrow scope, which should limit the number of potential proposals for this challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge is about encouraging Senior, which are 60 years old as the team's definition, join Cardano ecosystem. This is an interesting idea since the Senior are the one who be ignored while they tend to have much wealth after many years of accumulation. The Senior is currently not a target 'customer' since they tend to show not much care for crypto currency in general. However, if this hard math is solved, it will greatly beneficial for Cardano. If even your mom and dad or even your gramma believe in Cardano, who will not?
f6_assessments.q1: I think the challenge is interesting and motivating enough for many people to try to join it. However it's still hard to attract the Senior, so I'm not sure this challenge will be success in the definition of it: "Mom or Dad -worldwide - safely investing and being involved in the Cardano ecosystem with understanding and confidence." Honestly saying, I think this goal is quite ambitious. At first we can set the lower and safer goal: attract many young people to care more about the topic and then they will action on it.
f6_assessments.q2: The Key metrics are on point, they set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge. However I think the success criteria is quite hard to get as I said above.

importance: Diversity in an ecosystem is critical and Seniors cross all boundries and stereotypes. Grow the senior market globally to grow Cardano.
success: Success looks like Mom or Dad -worldwide - safely investing and being involved in the Cardano ecosystem with understanding and confidence.
